revised_title: Experiments on Preserving Water and Fish Sweet with Lime-Water
tldr: The author investigates the effectiveness of lime-water in preserving water and fish sweet. He finds that stone-lime, as opposed to chalk-lime, can preserve water from putrefaction and can keep fish sweet for an extended period. The antiseptic properties of lime-water are discussed, and the author suggests that fish may not be as corruptible as previously thought.
